document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the West Palaearctic species of the genus Pales Robineau­Desvoidy (Diptera: Tachinidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the West Palaearctic species of the genus Pales Robineau­Desvoidy (Diptera: Tachinidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Tachina processioneae
Ratzeburg, 1840
: 125
. Type locality: Köln, Nordrhein [ Germany ].
Pales bellierella
Robineau­Desvoidy, 1863
: 519
. Type locality: M. Bellier de la Chavignerie [ France ]. Established by
Herting ( 1990 : 2 )
.

Phorocera cilipeda
Rondani, 1859
: 162
, 167. Type locality: “agro parmensi” [Parma, Italy ]. Recently established by Cerretti, ( 2004 : 231 ).

Pales opulenta
Herting, 1980
: 2
. Type locality: Kaiserstuhl [SW Germany ]. Established by
Herting ( 1990 : 2 )
.

ASIA : TURKEY
— Kirklareli Tamer Öymen ex
Lymantria dispar
, 1 ɗ (only terminalia) ( SMNS ) (cf. Herting 1980 , 1990 ).

Diagnosis . Thorax (except scutellum) black in ground colour; scutellum red on posterior 1 / 3 or more (rarely less). Abdomen black in ground colour (sides of tergites 3 and 4 usually reddish) with blue reflections, covered with more or less weak microtrichosity. Tibiae usually uniformly brown, or partially yellow or yellowish. Height of facial ridge 0.95–1.07 times as long as frons. ɗ: postpedicel 3.0– 3.7 times as long as pedicel; lateral vertical seta weak, not or slightly differentiated from the postocular setulae; frons 0.63– 0.75 times as wide as an eye in dorsal view; claws and pulvilli at least as long as tarsomere 5 (fore claws longer than tarsomere 5 ); cerci broad and relatively short in posterior view not convex basally and not bent posteriorly in lateral view ( Figs 24, 25 );. Ψ: postpedicel about 2.4–2.9 times as long as pedicel; lateral vertical seta strong, well differentiated from the postocular row; frons 0.81–0.95 times as wide as an eye in dorsal view.

Hosts . Lepidoptera : a constant and common parasitoid of
Thaumetopoea processionea (Linnaeus)
( Notodontidae ), although data concerning other species are available:
Thaumetopoea ispartaensis Doğanlar & Avc
₁ ( Notodontidae ) (Avc ₁ &
Kara 2002
);
Lymantria dispar (Linnaeus)
( Lymantriidae );
Hoplodrina respersa (Denis & Schiffermüller)
,
Noctua fimbriata (Schreber)
,
N. janthina (Denis & Schiffermüller)
( Noctuidae );
Galleria mellonella (Linnaeus)
( Pyralidae ).
